title: 10 best lip plumpers for a perfect pout
text:
It’s been years since Kylie Jenner first stepped out with fuller lips, but just like her infamous pout, the trend shows no signs of disappearing.

With the Kardashian-Jenners seemingly influencing every trend on social media, it’s no surprise that demand for lip fillers surged more than 200 per cent in 2018.

However, surgically augmenting your lips is a costly business, and for those reluctant to undergo cosmetic treatment or splash out hundreds, the only answer lies in lip plumpers.

But with such high expectations, the reality is that some of these products often do little more than act as an overpriced lip gloss. While they promise to use natural ingredients such as caffeine, collagen or peppermint to stimulate blood flow or cause irritation minor enough to plump your lips, it’s tricky to formulate a product that will work for all, or that won’t go a step too far and cause an all out allergic reaction.

To find the best solution to lacklustre lips, we sought effects as close to natural-looking lip fillers as possible. We put glosses, balms and lipsticks alike to the test to see just how much volume we could gain without facing the needle.

If you’re looking for products that will actually add moisture, definition and fullness to your lips, here are the top non-surgical options to boost your pout.

You can trust our independent reviews. We may earn commission from some of the retailers, but we never allow this to influence selections, which are formed from real-world testing and expert advice. This revenue helps us to fund journalism across The Independent.

Too Faced lip injection extreme: £22, Debenhams

As the name suggests, this clear lip plumper has one goal: surgical results, without the actual needle. It definitely provides the most extreme sensation of all the products tested — lips tingle and heat up for nearly twenty minutes — and gives the quickest results. However, what really sets this product apart is its long-term benefits. Determined to one-up their already infamous lip injection gloss, the extreme edition of Too Faced’s latest cult product claims to gradually make lips bigger over time. After just one week of daily use, our tester found that her lips held the plumping effect even when the gloss was wiped off to apply lipstick.

Buy now

Fenty Beauty gloss bomb lip luminiser: £16, Harvey Nichols

Strictly speaking, this isn’t a lip plumper. On a mission to create the “perfect gloss,'' Fenty promises to condition your way to plumper lips. We love the peach scent and how easy it is to layer this gloss. Unlike a lot of lip products, gloss bomb manages to withstand talking, eating and drinking, leaving you with Rihanna-approved lips all day long. Another surprising bonus is its pigmentation. Gloss bomb is a self-proclaimed “universal nude” which doesn’t wash out any skin tone, but if you’re looking for other options, they now offer two additional shades – fu$$y (a pale pink) and diamond milk (a shimmering pearl).

Buy now

Dr Dennis Gross Skincare hyaluronic marine collagen lip cushion: £32, Cult Beauty

A lot of lip plumpers are about instant gratification, but Dr Dennis Gross Skincare is formulated by the dermatologic surgeon of the same name – in short, its products are in it for the long haul. This plumper looks and feels like a regular lip balm, but is packed with marine algae, hyaluronic acid and antioxidants. Combined, these ingredients define the outline of your lips and revive their natural hue. Over the course of a few weeks, our looks looked much healthier and substantially fuller. Those who prefer a matte look will also appreciate how well this sits beneath lipstick, thanks to its lack of a glossy finish.

Buy now

Soap and Glory sexy mother pucker pillow plump XXL: £12.90, Amazon

If you’re a long-term fan of lip plumpers, odds are this was your first purchase. Soap and Glory’s sexy mother pucker is a cult classic, pairing a hardcore stinging sensation with equally potent results – lips look beestung and full for hours after use. While this means you don’t need to reapply too often, it does leave quite a sticky residue on your lips, so doesn’t pair well over lipstick. However, it is available in a range of pigmented options if you prefer some colour on your pout.

Buy now

Dior Addict lip maximiser: £28, Debenhams

As luxurious a product as the brand name suggests, this is another collagen-based lip maximiser that promises to smooth and moisturise your pout. The effects are noticeable immediately, with only a gentle tingling sensation that is more refreshing than painful. It wears well throughout the day, but our tester found the vanilla scent so addictive that she applied it multiple times anyway. However, despite promising to firm the lips over time, we found that there was no lasting difference after 14 days of use.

Buy now

Algenist genius liquid collagen lip: £36, Cult Beauty

Algae is packed with nutrients, harnessed by Algenist to create some of the most transformative products out there. Together with collagen, both ingredients fill out your pout and reduce the appearance of fine lines or wrinkles around the lip line. The consistency is unusual at first, feeling lumpy due to the small beads of microalgae, but once they’re absorbed lips feel deeply hydrated and smooth.

Buy now

Fillerina lip volume treatment dosage 2: £50, Feel Unique

As the first dermo cosmetic filler designed for home use, this felt the closest to an actual surgical treatment. Despite its clinical-looking packaging and usage directions, it applies like any lip balm. Available in a range of strengths, our tester opted for dosage 2 which promises to increase lip volume thanks to six different hyaluronic acid molecules. Our tester was surprised by how effective this formula was — it may not return immediate results, but after the recommended five daily applications across two weeks, lips felt plumper and smoother. It might boast a hefty price tag, but if you’re looking for long-term improvement, this could be the one for you.

Buy now

Yves Saint Laurent volupte plump-in-colour: £29, YSL Beauty

Combining the pigment of a lipstick with the plumping effects of a gloss, this product looks and feels luxurious. Its coconut and pomegranate oil formula boosts hydration, while its use of peppermint and glycols (sneakily hidden inside the black heart on the tip of the lipstick) increases circulation, hence the plumping effect. Although it doesn’t have as extreme an effect as its competitors, it wins points for versatility, eliminating the need for a pigmented product alongside a plumper. We loved how subtle the plumping was and while it’s available in eight shades, our favourite was lunatic red.

Buy now

Charlotte Tilbury collagen lip bath: £25, John Lewis & Partners

Promisingly, this lip plumper contains collagen, best known as the chemical filler of choice for cosmetic surgeons across the world. While the effects aren’t quite as extreme as you’d get at the hands of said surgeon, the peppermint and coconut oil formula gives your lips a moisturised, nude glow that has the added bonus of making your lips feel truly nourished after use. This formula can be used as a replacement for lip balm, but also sits perfectly over lipstick to give your makeup some extra definition. It comes out on top for longevity and those with dry or chapped lips will love this product.

Buy now

Rodial dragon’s blood XXL lip plumper: £23, Space NK

If we were judging on the name of products alone, this would be our winner. Thankfully, the formula lives up to the name. While it feels quite thick on application, it translates to heavy moisturisation and left our tester’s lips hydrated all day long. Unlike a lot of plumpers, there’s no tingling sensation and we suspect that most of the plumping effect comes from the improved health of your lips. This is an ideal choice for colder weather, when chapped lips can come across thin or pale.

Buy now

The verdict: Lip plumpers

Too Faced’s lip injection extreme lives up to its name as the most effective, fast-acting plumper on this list. However, if you’re looking to improve the health and hydration of your lips in the long term, we love Dr Dennis Gross Skincare’s hyaluronic marine collagen lip cushion.

IndyBest product reviews are unbiased, independent advice you can trust. On some occasions, we earn revenue if you click the links and buy the products, but we never allow this to bias our coverage. The reviews are compiled through a mix of expert opinion and real-world testing.
description: Enjoy a fuller pout with the best lip plumpers from Fenty Beauty, Too Faced, Charlotte Tilbury and more
